Experience: Co-founder and managing partner at ALPEMI Consulting, LLC, which is a small business specializing on diverse areas such as simulation based engineering (SBE) applications, high performance computing (HPC), uncertainty quantification, process quality improvement through six sigma, supply chains, and inventory control.

Principal investigator of the 2015 ASCR Leadership Computing Challenge (ALCC) award granted by the Advanced Scientific Computing Research (ASCR) for the joint project titled "Credible Predictive Simulation Capabilities for Advanced Clean Energy Technology Development through Uncertainty Quantification". ALCC program awards support scientists from industry, academia and national laboratories pursuing scientific and technological research in energy related fields. 111.5 million hours of supercomputing allocation was granted at the Argonne Leadership Computing Facility (ALCF) of Argonne National Laboratory. In 2014, 37.5 million hours were awarded through the same program at National Energy Research Scientific Computing Center (NERSC) of Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory.
School of Computing, Informatics, and Decision Systems Engineering (SCIDSE) Arizona State University
Principal Investigator for the project "MFIX-DEM Phi: Performance and Capability Improvements toward Industrial Grade Open-source DEM Framework with Integrated Uncertainty Quantification".

Leading a multi-institution team consisting of co-PIs at Arizona State University (ASU), Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) and Sandia National Laboratories (SNL) to improve the performance and capabilities of MFIX-DEM CFD software towards industrial adoption of the open source CFD tools. MFIX suite of CFD software are an open-source computational fluid dynamics tools developed and maintained by National Energy Technology Laboratory (https://mfix.netl.doe.gov). This project aims to demonstrate the use of an open-source software tool by our two industrial collaborators for industrial scale problems after the implementation of proposed improvements.

Co-founder of Aeolus Research, Inc., which is a small high-tech consulting firm focusing on computational fluid dynamics applications on Beowulf cluster type high-performance parallel computing platforms. Received 2007 R&D 100 award as part of the core team at National Energy Technology Laboratory for contributions to MFIX code, which is redefining the role of coal for future power plants with zero emissions.
Supported by the Anna and Paul Erdos postdoctoral fellowship.
